newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys recovers, up 4 pct on BSE.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys recovers, up 4 pct on BSE.

text.p: Shares of Indian software firm Infosys Technologies Ltd showed a technical recovery, gaining 86.75 rupees or four percent to 2,065.0 at the Bombay bourse on Tuesday after the previous session's 10 percent fall, dealers said.

Market participants said the stock attracted some investment buying at current levels after tumbling on Monday amid talk that the holdings of foreign institutional investors might have reached the government-set 30 percent ceiling.
Over 9,100 shares of Infosys changed hands at the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) by early afternoon on Tuesday.
"There is still a big earnings story in Infosys," said Ajay Srinivasan, chief investment officer at ITC-Threadneedle Asset Management Ltd.
Earlier in July, Infosys said its first quarter profits jumped 103 percent on a 73 percent increase in total revenues.
The firm said its net profit for the first three months to June 30, 1997 rose to 92.2 million rupees from 45.5 million rupees.
At the National Stock Exchange, Infosys shares lost 157.0 rupees, or seven percent, at 2,086.20 with 11,100 shares traded on the last day of weekly trade at the exchange.
